answers.answer: If it was from the scleral buckle procedure applying too much pressure, it likely would have happened right away and not two weeks later.  At your age, ischemic optic neuropathy is a possibility and should be suspected.  Especially if you have high blood pressure, diabetes, heart disease, or blood vessel problems elsewhere.  You also need to be checked to make sure you do not have Giant Cell Arteritis which could present that way sometimes and has other symptoms like headache, jaw ache after chewing, scalp tenderness, weight loss, etc.  You should also discuss with your primary care specialist whether you are at risk for stroke or not.  Finally, if you still have concerns about the retina surgery, get a consultation from another retina specialist for a second opinion.HV
